ev3dev.hardware.actuators.motors

Class BasicMotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ev3dev.hardware.Device
      • ev3dev.hardware.EV3DevDevice
        • ev3dev.hardware.EV3DevMotorDevice
          • ev3dev.hardware.actuators.motors.BasicMotor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SupportedPlatform, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, BaseMotor, DCMotor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UnregulatedMotor

    public abstract class BasicMotor
extends EV3DevMotorDevice
implements DCMotor
    Abstraction for basic motors operations. Unregulated motors only is enabled for EV3Brick.

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns true iff the motors is in motion.

        Returns:
        true iff the motors is currently in motion.

      • brake

        public void brake()
        Causes motors to float. The motors will lose all power, but this is not the same as stopping. Use this method if you don't want your robot to trip in abrupt turns.
        Specified by:
        brake in interface BaseMotor

      • hold

        public void hold()
        Causes the motor to actively try to hold the current position. If an external force tries to turn the motor, the motor will “push back” to maintain its position.
        Specified by:
        hold in interface BaseMotor

      • coast

        public void coast()
        Removes power from the motor. The motor will freely coast to a stop.
        Specified by:
        coast in interface BaseMotor

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Causes motors to stop, pretty much instantaneously. In other words, the motors doesn't just stop; it will resist any further motion. Cancels any rotate() orders in progress
        Specified by:
        stop in interface BaseMotor
